script: Finding out you were pregnant in the early 1500s was just a massive guessing game... until the Tudor Needle Test! Forget peeing on a boring plastic stick. They literally dropped a metal sewing needle into a wooden bowl filled with urine. If the needle rusted or turned bright red a few days later, congratulations, you were officially declared pregnant! To read the crazy actual research behind this disgusting historical test, check the link in the description!

scenes.prompt: Hyper-realistic portrait photography of a beautiful Tudor-era noblewoman looking extremely stressed and confused. She is wearing a lavish, intricately embroidered Tudor gown with a French hood. She is holding her stomach. Dimly lit rustic wooden room, 8k resolution, cinematic lighting, dramatic shadows, documentary style realism, highly detailed, shot on 35mm lens, photorealistic. No painting.

Hyper-realistic portrait photography of a medieval doctor in a plague doctor mask staring blankly in confusion, holding a completely blank scroll. Dark stone Tudor castle background, 8k resolution, cinematic lighting, dramatic shadows, documentary style realism, highly detailed, shot on 35mm lens, photorealistic. No painting.

Hyper-realistic close-up photography of a modern plastic pregnancy test stick lying on a rustic wooden table, but the table is surrounded by archaic Tudor era medical instruments and burning candles. 8k resolution, cinematic lighting, dramatic shadows, documentary style realism, highly detailed, shot on 35mm lens, photorealistic. No painting.

She looks nervous. 8k resolution, cinematic lighting, dramatic shadows, documentary style realism, highly detailed, shot on 35mm lens, photorealistic. No painting.

A beautiful Tudor woman in a lavish, colorful velvet dress and French hood is looking nervously downwards into a wooden bowl on a table.
